intro: Brassica rapa var. lugdunensis, commonly known as the wild radish, is a species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in the spring. Its fruits are slender, elongated pods containing several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
